quiz.title: Physics Grade 11: Applied Forces & Friction Problems
quiz.subtitle: Unit 2 Quiz 6: Multi-Stage Motion with Constant Forces
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: A 2.0 kg block is given a brief push so it slides across a rough horizontal surface. It travels 4.0 m in the first 3.0 s, then slides an additional 2.5 m before stopping. What is the initial push force (constant during push)?
questions.explanation: Phase 1: $a_1 = 2d_1/t_1^2 = 8/9 \approx 0.8889$ m/s², $v = a_1 t_1 \approx 2.667$ m/s. Phase 2: $a_2 = -v^2/(2d_2) \approx -1.422$ m/s², $f = m|a_2| \approx 2.844$ N. Push force $F = m a_1 + f \approx 1.778 + 2.844 = 4.622$ N.

questions.question: For the same 2.0 kg block (4.0 m in 3.0 s, then 2.5 m to stop), what is the frictional force?
questions.explanation: From Phase 2: $a_2 = -v^2/(2d_2) \approx -1.422$ m/s², so frictional force $f = m|a_2| = 2.0 \times 1.422 \approx 2.844$ N.

questions.question: A 1.5 kg crate is pulled 5.0 m in 6.0 s, then slides 3.0 m more after release. What is the coefficient of kinetic friction?
questions.explanation: Phase 1: $a_1 = 10/36 \approx 0.2778$ m/s², $v \approx 1.667$ m/s. Phase 2: $a_2 \approx -0.4630$ m/s², $f = 1.5 \times 0.4630 \approx 0.6945$ N. $\mu_k = f/(mg) = 0.6945/14.7 \approx 0.0472$.

questions.question: A $0.80\ \text{kg}$ hockey puck is initially at rest on a rough, level surface. A constant horizontal force ($F$) is applied to the puck, causing it to travel $12\ \text{m}$ in $4.0\ \text{s}$. At the end of this $4.0\ \text{s}$ interval, the force $F$ is removed, and the puck coasts an additional $8.0\ \text{m}$ before coming to rest. Assuming the frictional force remains constant throughout the entire motion, what was the magnitude of the constant applied force ($F$)?
questions.explanation: Phase 1 (force + friction): $a_1 = 2d_1/t_1^2 = 2\times12/(4.0)^2 = 1.5\ \text{m/s}^2$, $v = a_1 t_1 = 6.0\ \text{m/s}$. Phase 2 (friction only): $0 = v^2 + 2a_2 d_2 \Rightarrow a_2 = -36/(2\times8.0) = -2.25\ \text{m/s}^2$. Friction $f = m|a_2| = 0.80\times2.25 = 1.80\ \text{N}$. Applied force $F = m a_1 + f = 0.80\times1.5 + 1.80 = 3.00\ \text{N}$.

questions.question: A 3.0 kg box is pushed 2.0 m in 5.0 s, then slides 1.0 m after release. What is the friction force?
A 0.60 kg model car covers 3.0 m in 7.0 s under power, then rolls 2.0 m to stop. What is the motor force?
questions.explanation: Phase 1: $a_1 \approx 0.12245$ m/s², $v \approx 0.8571$ m/s. Phase 2: $a_2 \approx -0.1837$ m/s², $f \approx 0.1102$ N. Motor force $F \approx 0.60 \times 0.12245 + 0.1102 \approx 0.1837$ N.

questions.question: A 2.5 kg sled pulled 8.0 m in 10 s, then slides 4.0 m after release. What is the snow friction force?
A 1.2 kg block moves 1.5 m in 4.0 s under force, then 0.75 m after force stops. What is the applied force?
A 4.0 kg cart pushed 6.0 m in 8.0 s, then coasts 3.0 m. What is the push force?
A 5.0 kg package dragged 10 m in 12 s, then slides 6.0 m after release. What is the pulling force?
questions.explanation: Phase 1: $a_1 \approx 0.13889$ m/s², $v \approx 1.6667$ m/s. Phase 2: $a_2 \approx -0.23148$ m/s², $f \approx 1.1574$ N. Pull force $F \approx 5.0 \times 0.13889 + 1.1574 \approx 1.85185$ N.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered multi-stage motion analysis with applied and frictional forces.
scoreMessages.70: Very good! Solid understanding of kinematics with constant acceleration phases.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Practice separating motion into distinct phases with different net forces.
